title: Mortal Kombat 1 - All KONFIRMED Characters and Kameos So Far! #shorts
description:
Mortal Kombat 1 had its gameplay revealed at Summer Game Fest, confirming more additions to the roster. The new Kameo Fighters include the likes of Kano, Jax, Sonya Blade, Goro (yes, that Goro), Stryker, Kung Lao and Sub-Zero.

They have their OG looks, and you can summon them to perform Special Moves, set up combos, and even sick Fatalities in battles. You can't spam them continuously, but they can provide great offensive and defensive options.

The main roster includes Kung Lao, Sub-Zero, Scorpion, Liu Kang, Raiden, Kitana and Mileena. Johnny Cage and Kenshi are newly confirmed, and Shang Tsung is a pre-order bonus. Everyone has different origins from the previous games, but many of their abilities - like Sub-Zero's Ice Clone and Scorpion's Stinger - remain.

Mortal Kombat 1 is out on September 19th for Xbox Series X/S, PS5, PC and Nintendo Switch, so stay tuned for more details.

title: Aliens: Dark Descent - 13 Things You NEED TO KNOW Before You Buy
description:
In Aliens: Dark Descent, players control a squad of Marines as they explore the Xenomorph-infested Lethe. With unique missions that remain persistent and enemy AI that adapts to your tactics, you'll need to command the squad as one to gather resources and make it out alive.

The alternative? Permadeath, which means bringing in recruits at the Otago, your ship and hub. Five Marine classes are available, each with unique upgrades and weapons like sniper rifles, RPG launchers, incinerator units, and more.

Meanwhile, you can research new technologies, upgrade weapons, manage the Medbay, and break up fights with Marines. Let's learn more about the squad-based action strategy title, which is out on June 20th for Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, PS4, PS5 and PC.

title: Starfield - EVERYTHING You Need To Know About 2023's Biggest Game
description:
To say that Starfield is one of the most highly anticipated games set to launch in 2023, even amongst the megatons that we’ve already seen this year, would be a massive understatement. After all, it’s not every day that we get to see a new flagship RPG by Bethesda Game Studios, who are and always have been absolute masters of that genre- especially one that’s a new IP. 

And though the response to all that we’d seen of it over the past couple of years had ranged from lukewarm to somewhat positive, with the recent Starfield Direct, BGS completely and thoroughly turned that around. With a ridiculously comprehensive deep dive, the developer showed off the upcoming space-faring RPG and told us exactly why we should be excited for it- and boy did they do it well. Here, we’re going to go through all of the major details they revealed about Starfield. So buckle in, because there’s a lot to get into.
